channel.title: How to set up rsps on linux?
channel.description:
I recently purchased a vps, unaware that it was linux, thought I was buying windows but now I'm stumped. I have no idea where to start on hosting a RSPS off a linux vps. If someone could help me set it up, I'd give them staff on my server or something.
My msn is teh_service@live.com
I'll give all details of the vps on msn.

item.title: How to set up rsps on linux?
item.dc:creator: @lugmfr lugmfr
item.description:
@lugmfr wrote:

Demon6994:

Good luck.

Ty sir

Read full topic

item.title: How to set up rsps on linux?
item.dc:creator: @lugmfr lugmfr
item.description:
@lugmfr wrote:

[quote=“F A I L S, post:22, topic:413894”][quote author=lugmfr link=topic=515860.msg3742405#msg3742405 date=1315458158]

Then talk to the provider you got your VPS from, and request to get it Windows. And pay whatever else needs to be paid for the Windows VPS then BAM. Done. XD

I may, although X10 support are usually dicks.
[/quote]a risk your going to have to take :D[/quote]

Indeed

Read full topic

item.title: How to set up rsps on linux?
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:16, topic:413894”]It’s pretty much the same way you run a server on a windows computer…

But I suggest you use the terminal to run the server…

It’s pretty easy to do…

cd /location/location/location

Until your in the same directory as your Server.java or what ever file is your main starting point of the application… Most servers use Server.java or server.java

Then all you have to do is type in.

java server or java Server

It will start the server and everything should work out fine…

Another thing you can do is, use and IDE…[/quote]
Using an IDE… on a server?

The server shouldn’t come with a display anyway, so he should be using SSH by default. Also, he has to install java first xD!

Read full topic
item.source: How to set up rsps on linux?

item.title: How to set up rsps on linux?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

It’s pretty much the same way you run a server on a windows computer…

But I suggest you use the terminal to run the server…

It’s pretty easy to do…

cd /location/location/location

Until your in the same directory as your Server.java or what ever file is your main starting point of the application… Most servers use Server.java or server.java

Then all you have to do is type in.

java server or java Server

It will start the server and everything should work out fine…

Another thing you can do is, use and IDE…

Read full topic

item.title: How to set up rsps on linux?
item.dc:creator: @lugmfr lugmfr
item.description:
@lugmfr wrote:

[quote=“F A I L S, post:6, topic:413894”][quote author=lugmfr link=topic=515860.msg3742366#msg3742366 date=1315456063]

There are multiple tuts on getting a server on Linux, use the search bar.

Don’t you think I have? Facepalm, I hate smartasses.

Ontopic, I agree every linux user does start somewhere but I’ve started somewhere and I’ve yet to move from that starting point! haha.
[/quote]I do have to agree, there are many tuts, but they can get very confusing. Ive never hosted on a linux, so i could not tell you. but i can try to find you a tut that can :D[/quote]

I’d appreciate it, I’ve looked through plenty of tutorials on hosting on linux, no luck so far.

Read full topic
